Draghi: There has been front loading in PSPP by 3 bn in May and 3 bn in June
Draghi: if we see an unwarranted tightening we will address this
Draghi: We don't see this as having changed the medium term outlook for price stability
Draghi: There has been a considerable increase in volatility in recent weeks which led to higher interest rates
Draghi: There are questions about implementation: will and capacity, up to the Greek Government to dispel these doubts
Draghi: All this experience shows that Europe has to act. Five Presidents’ report outlines areas of action https://t.co/UhjPmwwNdZ
Draghi: On July 20 we will be repayed
Draghi: We are revising our communication on ELA
Draghi: Capital controls are responsibility of Greek government
Draghi: Capital controls have protected depositors
Draghi: Our mandate is to act based on the assumption that Greece is and will be a member of the euro area
Draghi: All recent developments are improving quality of collateral pledged by Greek banks
Draghi: uncontroversial debt relief is necessary
Draghi: The overall purpose of Eurosummit text was to ensure Greece will become a thriving economy
Draghi: We acted always under the assumption Greece is a member of euro area
Draghi: Total exposure to Greece now 130 bn
Draghi: Liquidity provisions have never been unconditional and unlimited
Draghi: Increased ELA 900 mln over one week
Draghi: The ECB continues to act in the assumption Greece is and will remain a member of the euro area
Draghi: Decision to raise ELA took today symmetrical to decision to freeze ELA
Draghi: We decided to raise ELA today
ECB Introductory statement: http://t.co/lgMDaaYRzc
Draghi: Fiscal policies should support the economic recovery while remaining in compliance with the Stability and Growth Pact.
Draghi: The ongoing cyclical recovery should be supported by effective structural policies.
Draghi: Loan dynamics continued to improve.
Draghi: HICP inflation is expected to remain low in the months ahead and to rise towards the end of the year.
Draghi: Market-based inflation expectations have, on balance, stabilised or recovered further since our meeting in early June.
Draghi: The ECB’s monetary policy stance remains accommodative.
Draghi: The asset purchase programmes continue to proceed smoothly.
